Subject: Re: [neat] Re: CPPN node bloat
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=344770313; y=enyBT6ScJw-4_a51D-FM9vaMTV-3RT9qNcndkNkqtg3AK2nR84Oa
X-Yahoo-Profile: alienseedpod

One thing that might be worth trying when generating random test cases
is to cache test cases for some number of generations. One can then
either (A) completely replace the set of test cases every N
generations or (B) Use a rolling circular buffer to replace some small
proportion of cases each generation.

Such a scheme (B particularly) gives you a more constant fitness
landscape such that the fitness of genomes is comparable within a
generation and also to some degree between generations and thus
mitigates/alleviates some of the problems resulting from what is
effectively a noisy fitness landscape.

As for bloat, I take a pragmatic view that it exists to some extent
(which I think we can all agree on even if we don't agree by how much)
and thus some mechanism to contain it is desirable - hence phased
pruning.

BTW SharpNeat 2 development code does now provide HyperNEAT but alas
no phased pruning just yet.

Colin
